thread.title: Bride and Prejudice fans SLAM Courtney, 18, over ring | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Bride and Prejudice fans SLAM Courtney, 18, over ring | Daily Mail Online

author: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
title: Bride and Prejudice fans SLAM Courtney, 18, over ring | Daily Mail Online
text: 942 shares Another wrote that they would slap Courtney for being so materialistic. 'It's not about the ring!!! But the commitment!! Lorddd (sic) if only you could slap someone through the telly Courtney.' Not happy: 'Courtney you wanna be a materialistic little b**ch that's all about the money then you can wait for your engagement ring,' one fan wrote Not holding back! Another wrote that they would slap Courtney for being so materialistic Bridezilla? On Monday, Courtney told Brad of her dream ring, which he then went and got custom-made for her at a hefty cost of $11,500 (seen at their engagement party) While one fan said she just wants the ring for the her Instagram, another person called her a 'spoiled brat.' Another added: 'A fake Vuitton bag, awful contouring and a back tatt (sic) hardly makes you "classy," and an $11K (sic) ring isn't going to hide that.' On the show, Brad, 20, was seen shopping for a new ring for his girl and said he was splashing out $11,500 for a custom-made sparkler. 'Courtney just wants something big and expensive really, and branded,' he said. To camera, Courtney said her 'dream ring' is a halo style with diamonds all around the band. Full on! Another added: 'A fake Vuitton bag, awful contouring and a back tatt (sic) hardly makes you "classy," and an $11K (sic) ring isn't going to hide that' Making sure she's happy: On the show, Brad, 20, was seen shopping for a new ring for his girl and said he was splashing out $11,500 for a custom-made sparkler He's trying! 'Courtney just wants something big and expensive really, and branded,' he said 'I hope that he gets the right ring,' she said. 'I'm a bit worried he won't get exactly what I want, but I have to trust him,' she said. At their engagement party, Courtney quizzed Brad about where her ring was, saying she was hoping she would have it in time for their engagement party. 'She has to realise she has to wait, it just doesn't come straight to her doorstep the next day,' Brad said to camera. Courtney vented to camera, saying she was 'so disappointed.' 'It's embarrassing, he doesn't get it, he's not a girl, he's not the one that everyone is going, "oh where's your engagement ring?" In the hot seat: At their engagement party, Courtney quizzed Brad about where her ring was, saying she was hoping she would have it in time for their engagement party Fancy: Courtney was also seen going wedding dress shopping, saying she doesn't want a gown 'straight off the rack' Brad said he would love to get away from all the 'stress.' Courtney was also seen going wedding dress shopping, saying she doesn't want a gown 'straight off the rack.' The pair have the full support of Courtney's parents, but not the support of Brad's mother, Sherrie, who believes they are too young to get married and they fight all the time. At the engagement party, Sherrie said marriage won't fix their relationship. 'They're still having arguments, toxic arguments, it's still happening, it's not mature,' Sherrie said. 'Marriage isn't going to change their situation, they are too young to get married, simple.' Unimpressed: At the engagement party, Brad's mother Sherrie said marriage won't fix their relationship and that they're too young to get married Share or comment on this article 942
